document_title: Iritis of the ciliary body: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Iritis can occur in one or both eyes. The disease often develops suddenly and can last up to three months. Symptoms of iritis include:
Red eyes, inflammation.; Discomfort or pain in the eyes; Sensitive to light.; Reduced vision.; Pupils are small or irregularly shaped on both sides.
Some factors that can make iritis worse include smoking, immunodeficiency diseases, and genetic changes that affect immune system function.
